note.p: Burial: St Mary's Extra, near Woolston, Southampton (18 April 1888)

Career: Entered Army Medical Service (1854); served with the Rifle Brigade in the Crimea; Assistant Professor (1863), Conjoint Professor (1875), finally Professor (1876), of Hygiene, Army Medical School; Lecturer in Hygiene to the Royal Engineers; Surgeon-Major, Army Medical Department (by 1874); had diabetes; died of heart failure
